doc.after: Telegraphy (from Greek: Ïá¿Î»Îµ tele, "at a distance" and Î³ÏÎ¬ÏÎµÎ¹Î½ graphein, "to write") is the long-distance transmission of textual/symbolic (as opposed to verbal or audio) messages without the physical exchange of an object bearing the message. Thus semaphore is a method of telegraphy, whereas pigeon post is not.
